content.text: Right away students will see that the locations of brothels and the arrests for prostitution do not correlate very well at all. The brothels are much closer to midtown Manhattan, while the arrests for prostitution are clustered much farther uptown. This finding raises historians' questions such as whether the police were working with the brothel owners in Harlem and so avoided arresting prostitutes close to the brothels, or conversely, if the police made the blocks around the brothels unfriendly locations for prostitutes to ply their trade, so they stayed further uptown? A

document.title: Teaching History in the Digital Age
document.author: Kelly, T. Mills
